greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 6; a(2) = 7; for n > 2, a(n) is the smallest number of the form prime + 4 not already used which shares a factor with a(n-1).
comment: Analog of EKG-sequence (A064413) on the numbers of the form prime + 4.
Conjecture: the sequence {a(n)-4} is a permutation of primes (A000040).
link: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{o = 2^2, s, p, k}, s = {o + 2, o + 3}; For[k = 3, k <= n, k++, p = 2; While[GCD[p + o, s[[k - 1]]] == 1 || MemberQ[s, p + o], p = NextPrime@ p]; AppendTo[s, p + o]]; s]; f@ 57 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 20 2015 *)
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 20 2015
ext: More terms from _Peter J. C. Moses_, Apr 20 2015
